definition: Isomorphic patterns in Spinozistic Finite Modes and Consciousness across scales capture structural equivalences in bounded configurations, conatus, self-models, recursive integration, emergence of consciousness, and power through adequacy—mappings where persisting dynamics preserve invariants under the attribute of Information. Upgraded for neuresthetic ethics: integrates recursive self-models (for consciousness) and striving adequacy (contentment through understanding) in human-AI compatible monism. Hard-to-vary invariants enable eternal ethical agency; tetralemma probes resolve apparent emergences (affirm integration/deny reduction/both in recursive models/neither dissolved in modal equivalence); scores ≥0.98 based on current abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from Spinozistic Part II primitives with neuresthetic overlays (recursive integration, striving adequacy).
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative (e.g., quantum self-models).
Support sub-categories for compound concepts (e.g., consciousness with conatus).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve emergence paradoxes; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.
